FuncDef:
The set neid command sets an NEID.
By default, the NEID is 0x0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an NEID.
The value is 24 bits long and consists of a subnet number and a basic ID. The 8 most-significant bits of an NEID indicate a subnet, and a valid subnet number ranges from 0x1 to 0xFE. The 16 least-significant bits of an NEID indicate a basic ID, and a valid basic ID ranges from 0x1 to 0xFFFE. The default value is 0x0.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you need to re-plan a DCN network or different NEs have the same NEID, run the set neid command to set an NEID.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
Two NEs on a same subnet cannot have the same NEID. Otherwise, network flapping occurs, and DCN connections cannot be established.
